meanings.definition: A person who makes or enacts laws.
meanings.sent1: The lawmakers gathered in the capitol to discuss new regulations.
meanings.sent2: The lawmakers voted on the proposed bill during the session.
meanings.sent3: The lawmakers had a picnic to brainstorm new rules for the playground.
meanings.sent4: The lawmakers were like architects, constructing the legal framework of society.
meanings.sent5: The lawmakers were the architects of justice, building a fair system for all.

meanings.definition: The legislative body responsible for creating laws.
meanings.sent1: The state lawmakers passed a bill to improve education in schools.
meanings.sent2: The national lawmakers debated the budget in the parliament.
meanings.sent3: The lawmakers had a bake-off to decide on the new tax policies.
meanings.sent4: The lawmakers were the engine driving the progress of the nation.
meanings.sent5: The lawmakers were the heart of democracy, pulsing with the will of the people.
